William the Conqueror.q: In what year did William the Conqueror defeat King Harold at the Battle of Hastings?
What famous tapestry depicts William's conquest of England?
What was William's title before he became King of England?
What system of land tenure did William establish in England?
What great survey did William commission to record English lands and resources?

King Arthur.q: What was the name of King Arthur's legendary sword?
Who was Arthur's trusted wizard and advisor?
What was the name of Arthur's legendary court?
What shape was the table around which Arthur's knights gathered?

Richard the Lionheart.q: Which Crusade was Richard the Lionheart famous for leading?
Who was Richard's main opponent during the Third Crusade?
How much time did Richard actually spend in England during his reign?
Where was Richard captured and held for ransom on his way back from the Crusades?
What was the enormous ransom paid for Richard's release?

Thomas Becket.q: Which king had Thomas Becket murdered in Canterbury Cathedral?
What position did Thomas Becket hold that led to his conflict with the king?
In what year was Thomas Becket murdered?
What famous quote is attributed to Henry II regarding Becket?
Thomas Becket.a: Will no one rid me of this turbulent priest?

Thomas Becket.q: How long after his death was Thomas Becket canonized as a saint?

Geoffrey Chaucer.q: What is Geoffrey Chaucer's most famous work?
To which shrine were Chaucer's pilgrims traveling?
In what language did Chaucer write most of his works?
What was Chaucer's profession besides writing?
How many tales were planned for The Canterbury Tales?

blessingCards.title: Divine Right of Kings
blessingCards.effect: Gain 4 gold immediately and become immune to Brigand attacks for 3 turns. Royal authority protects the faithful.

blessingCards.title: Knight's Oath
blessingCards.effect: Gain 3 gold and choose any character to gain 2 points with. Honor and valor open all doors.

blessingCards.title: Pilgrim's Grace
blessingCards.effect: Move immediately to any monastery location on the board. Divine guidance leads the faithful to wisdom.

blessingCards.title: Scholar's Wisdom
blessingCards.effect: For your next 3 turns, gain +1 gold for every correct answer (4 total instead of 3). Knowledge is power.

blessingCards.title: Merchant's Fortune
blessingCards.effect: Gain 2 gold and recover all lost provisions. Prosperity follows the industrious.

blessingCards.title: Abbot's Blessing
blessingCards.effect: Immunity to all Dark Sorcery effects for the next 4 turns. Sacred protection shields the devout.

blessingCards.title: Royal Pardon
blessingCards.effect: When you would lose gold from any source, this card prevents all loss. Discard after use.

blessingCards.title: Round Table Fellowship
blessingCards.effect: All players gain 2 gold. The greatest virtue brings benefit to all.

blessingCards.title: Merlin's Magic
blessingCards.effect: Look at any other player's gold total, provisions, and helpers. Gain 2 gold from mystical insight.

blessingCards.title: Holy Grail Vision
blessingCards.effect: Gain 5 gold. The ultimate quest brings the greatest reward.

curseCards.title: Black Death
curseCards.effect: All players lose half their provisions (rounded down). The great pestilence spares none.

curseCards.title: Norman Invasion
curseCards.effect: Lose 3 gold and 2 provisions. Foreign conquest brings suffering to the land.

curseCards.title: Excommunication
curseCards.effect: For your next 3 turns, you cannot use Helper hints or earn Helper points. Spiritual exile cuts deep.

curseCards.title: Dragon's Wrath
curseCards.effect: Roll two dice and lose that much gold. Ancient evil brings great destruction.

curseCards.title: Famine and Want
curseCards.effect: Pay 4 gold immediately or lose your next turn. Starvation weakens even the strong.

curseCards.title: Civil War
curseCards.effect: Choose: either lose 4 gold or take double damage from your next Wolf Pack encounter.

curseCards.title: Corrupt Sheriff
curseCards.effect: All players must pay you 1 provision or lose 3 gold. Tyranny exploits the innocent.

curseCards.title: Viking Raid
curseCards.effect: All other players lose 2 gold. The northern reavers take what they will.

curseCards.title: Witch's Curse
curseCards.effect: For the next 3 turns, you can only earn half gold from correct answers (rounded down). Dark magic hinders progress.

curseCards.title: Peasant Revolt
curseCards.effect: Choose a player. They cannot earn gold for 2 turns and you steal 1 of their Helpers. Revolution upends order.
